title: Check whether E5220 has been successfully installed
answer:
A:

1. Click ![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20140924091726787001.jpg) and find “My Computer” as ![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20140924091726895002.jpg). Right click “My Computer” select “Manage” to open the “Computer Management” Click “![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20140924091726789003.jpg)”. If E5220 has been installed successfully, You would see two new “com port”, “USB Mass Storage Device” , “USB Composite Device” and “HUAWEI Mobil Connect– 3G Network Card ” displayed in![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20140924091726789003.jpg) .

![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20140924091726449004.jpg)

If “HUAWEI Mobil Connect – 3G Network Card” shows![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20140924091726331005.jpg), right click it then select “Uninstall”. Re-load the network driver for E5220 by right click![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20140924091726258006.jpg), then select “Scan for hardware changes”.
